body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of Kentucky,

The undersigned respectfully represents, that the Grand jury of Boyle County having returned an Indictment against him for Gaming, he did on the 8th day of August 1865, and during the sitting of the Boyle Circuit Court at the instance of the attorney for the Commonwealth's atty, Confess a judgement on Said Indictment for the sum of Five Hundred Dollars, He states that he was charged with setting up a Faro table, in said Indictment, that the Circumstances are about these, being in the town of Danville some Months ago, he went into a room of the Hotel where he was stopping a number of Gentlemen importuned him to deal faro as a matter of amusement for a short time and having nothing particular to do for the time being he Consented, and did play at said game for a short time, for which he was indicted as aforesaid and has Confessed judgement, He would further represent that he
is a mechanic by occupation, has a large family, and is poor and that he Cannot pay Said fine of Five Hundred Dollars and Provide for his family, he therefore asks your Excellency to remit said fine.
We the undersigned, respectfully represent to Your Excellency that we know the petitioner William Chambers, and that we regard his a proper Case for executive clemency
I Know nothing of the Merits of the Petition but concur in its prayer

J F Bell
Jno. S. VanWinkle
M T. Chrisman
J. B Nichols
M Chiles
J. P. Young
W R Boie

Boyle Cir Ct
Wm Chambers
} Petition for remission
Judgt. Boyle ct. ct.
Rendered 17th Aug 1865
Five Hundred Dollrs
Remit except $50. & fees & costs
15 Sept 1865
